member.name: M:DevComponents.WpfDock.DockSite.GetDockSize(System.Windows.UIElement)
member.summary: Gets the docked size of the element docked inside of the dock site. The property should be applied to the SplitPanel controls to indicate their inital docking size. Size specified depends on the docking side of the SplitPanel. If docked to top or bottom size specified indicates height. If docked to left or right the size specified indicates width.
member.param: Reference to the UI element
member.returns: Return the Dock size assigned to the element.

member.name: M:DevComponents.WpfDock.DockSite.SetDockSize(System.Windows.UIElement,System.Double)
member.summary: Assigns the docked size to element docked inside of the dock site. The property should be applied to the SplitPanel controls to indicate their inital docking size. Size specified depends on the docking side of the SplitPanel. If docked to top or bottom size specified indicates height. If docked to left or right the size specified indicates width.
member.param: Reference to the UI Element.
Specifies the docked element size.

member.param: UIElement to return setting for.
member.returns: true if element is docked as document otherwise false.

member.name: M:DevComponents.WpfDock.DockSite.FloatWindow(DevComponents.WpfDock.DockWindow)
member.summary: Floats the specified DockWindow. If DockWindow is part of DockWindowGroup with multiple DockWindows the DockWindow specified is removed from DockWindowGroup and placed into the floating state alone. If DockWindow is the only window inside of parent DockWindowGroup the DockWindowGroup is placed into the floating state.
member.param: Reference to the DockWindow to place into the floating state.
member.returns: Returns true if operation was performed or false if it was not performed or cancelled.

member.name: M:DevComponents.WpfDock.DockSite.DockWindow(DevComponents.WpfDock.DockWindowGroup,DevComponents.WpfDock.eDockSide,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Docks the DockWindowGroup to specified side and optionally allows docking the window at the full size. Windows docked at full-size will consume the full width (top or bottom dock) or height (left or right dock) of the dock site. Otherwise the dock window is docked as the inner dock window.
member.param: Reference to DockWindowGroup to dock.
Side to dock window to. Valid sides are Left, Top, Right and Bottom.
True if DockWindowGroup is docked so it consumes full width or height of the dock site.
member.returns: Returns true if operation was performed or false if it was not performed or cancelled.

member.name: P:DevComponents.WpfDock.DockSite.MinimumDockWindowSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the suggested minimum size for the dock windows when resized. Note that this is recommendation and due to constraint of the parent window size the minimum size might not be always obeyed.

member.name: P:DevComponents.WpfDock.DockSite.CanAutoHideDockWindowPopup
member.summary: Gets or sets whether any open auto-hide dock window popups are automatically closed when their content loses input focus. You may set this property to false when showing modal dialogs and want to keep popup open.

member.name: P:DevComponents.WpfDock.DockSite.MinimumDocumentAreaSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum size of the Document area of docking control. Default value is 32,32.

member.name: P:DevComponents.WpfDock.DockSite.VisualStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the DockSite style.

member.name: P:DevComponents.WpfDock.DockSite.EffectiveStyle
member.summary: Gets the effective DockSite style.

member.name: P:DevComponents.WpfDock.DockSite.KeyboardNavigationEnabled
member.summary: Gets whether Ctrl+Tab keyboard navigation is enabled. Default value is true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.WpfDock.DockSite.AutoHidePopupOverlay
member.summary: Gets or sets whether auto-hide dock window popup is displayed on top-level window. Default value is false. If you are using Windows Forms or other Windowed controls and auto-hide popup is showing below these controls, set this property to true to use popup overlay so popups display on top of Windows.

member.name: P:DevComponents.WpfDock.DockSite.SelectorCycleAllWindows
member.summary: Gets or sets whether all windows are cycled through on dock window selector invoked using Ctrl+Tab keys or just document windows. Default value is false which indicates that only document windows are cycled.

member.name: P:DevComponents.WpfDock.DockSite.IsAnimationEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether animation between states of the control is enabled. Default value is true. You can set this property to false to disable the animation between control states.

member.name: P:DevComponents.WpfDock.DockSite.DockHintOverlay
member.summary: Indicates whether docking hint overlay is used to display the docking hints. Setting this property to true will allow docking hints to overlay the Windows Forms controls on the dock site but it might slighlty degrade the performance. Default value is false.

member.name: P:DevComponents.WpfDock.DockSite.DockSelectorOverlay
member.summary: Indicates whether a translucent overlay window is used to display the dock selector. Setting this property to true will allow docking hints to overlay the Windows Forms controls on the dock site but it might slighlty degrade the performance. Default value is false.

member.name: P:DevComponents.WpfDock.DockSite.IgnoreLoadLayoutElementNotFoundErrors
member.summary: Gets or sets whether control ignores the errors when loading layout due to the DockWindow controls not found by name. Default value is false which indicates that control will throw exceptions indicating that DockWindow controls are not found if presented in layout but not part of DockSite.

member.name: E:DevComponents.WpfDock.DockSite.DockChanged

member.name: E:DevComponents.WpfDock.DockSite.AfterDocked

member.summary: Gets or sets default floating rectangle for the dock window. The location part of the rectangle specified will be used only when window is floated by your code or by end-user double-clicking the dock window group caption. Size part of the rectangle will be always used as default floating size for the dock window. Size part will also be updated if end-user resizes the floating window.

member.name: T:DevComponents.WpfDock.WinApi.WindowHitTestRegions
member.summary: Options available when a form is tested for mouse positions.

member.name: F:DevComponents.WpfDock.WinApi.WindowHitTestRegions.Error
member.summary: HTERROR: On the screen background or on a dividing line between windows (same as HTNOWHERE, except that the DefWindowProc function produces a system beep to indicate an error).

member.name: F:DevComponents.WpfDock.WinApi.WindowHitTestRegions.TransparentOrCovered
member.summary: HTTRANSPARENT: In a window currently covered by another window in the same thread (the message will be sent to underlying windows in the same thread until one of them returns a code that is not HTTRANSPARENT).

member.name: F:DevComponents.WpfDock.WinApi.WindowHitTestRegions.NoWhere
member.summary: HTNOWHERE: On the screen background or on a dividing line between windows.

member.name: F:DevComponents.WpfDock.WinApi.WindowHitTestRegions.ClientArea
member.summary: HTCLIENT: In a client area.

member.name: F:DevComponents.WpfDock.WinApi.WindowHitTestRegions.TitleBar
member.summary: HTCAPTION: In a title bar.

member.name: F:DevComponents.WpfDock.WinApi.WindowHitTestRegions.SystemMenu
member.summary: HTSYSMENU: In a window menu or in a Close button in a child window.

member.name: F:DevComponents.WpfDock.WinApi.WindowHitTestRegions.GrowBox
member.summary: HTGROWBOX: In a size box (same as HTSIZE).

member.name: F:DevComponents.WpfDock.WinApi.WindowHitTestRegions.Menu
member.summary: HTMENU: In a menu.

member.name: F:DevComponents.WpfDock.WinApi.WindowHitTestRegions.HorizontalScrollBar
member.summary: HTHSCROLL: In a horizontal scroll bar.

member.name: F:DevComponents.WpfDock.WinApi.WindowHitTestRegions.VerticalScrollBar
member.summary: HTVSCROLL: In the vertical scroll bar.

member.name: F:DevComponents.WpfDock.WinApi.WindowHitTestRegions.MinimizeButton
member.summary: HTMINBUTTON: In a Minimize button.

member.name: F:DevComponents.WpfDock.WinApi.WindowHitTestRegions.MaximizeButton
member.summary: HTMAXBUTTON: In a Maximize button.

member.name: F:DevComponents.WpfDock.WinApi.WindowHitTestRegions.LeftSizeableBorder
member.summary: HTLEFT: In the left border of a resizable window (the user can click the mouse to resize the window horizontally).

member.name: F:DevComponents.WpfDock.WinApi.WindowHitTestRegions.RightSizeableBorder
member.summary: HTRIGHT: In the right border of a resizable window (the user can click the mouse to resize the window horizontally).

member.name: F:DevComponents.WpfDock.WinApi.WindowHitTestRegions.TopSizeableBorder
member.summary: HTTOP: In the upper-horizontal border of a window.

member.name: F:DevComponents.WpfDock.WinApi.WindowHitTestRegions.TopLeftSizeableCorner
member.summary: HTTOPLEFT: In the upper-left corner of a window border.

member.name: F:DevComponents.WpfDock.WinApi.WindowHitTestRegions.TopRightSizeableCorner
member.summary: HTTOPRIGHT: In the upper-right corner of a window border.

member.name: F:DevComponents.WpfDock.WinApi.WindowHitTestRegions.BottomSizeableBorder
member.summary: HTBOTTOM: In the lower-horizontal border of a resizable window (the user can click the mouse to resize the window vertically).

member.name: F:DevComponents.WpfDock.WinApi.WindowHitTestRegions.BottomLeftSizeableCorner
member.summary: HTBOTTOMLEFT: In the lower-left corner of a border of a resizable window (the user can click the mouse to resize the window diagonally).

member.name: F:DevComponents.WpfDock.WinApi.WindowHitTestRegions.BottomRightSizeableCorner
member.summary: HTBOTTOMRIGHT: In the lower-right corner of a border of a resizable window (the user can click the mouse to resize the window diagonally).

member.name: F:DevComponents.WpfDock.WinApi.WindowHitTestRegions.NonSizableBorder
member.summary: HTBORDER: In the border of a window that does not have a sizing border.

member.name: F:DevComponents.WpfDock.WinApi.WindowHitTestRegions.Object
member.summary: HTOBJECT: Unknown...No Documentation Found

member.name: F:DevComponents.WpfDock.WinApi.WindowHitTestRegions.CloseButton
member.summary: HTCLOSE: In a Close button.

member.name: F:DevComponents.WpfDock.WinApi.WindowHitTestRegions.HelpButton
member.summary: HTHELP: In a Help button.

member.name: F:DevComponents.WpfDock.WinApi.WindowHitTestRegions.SizeBox
member.summary: HTSIZE: In a size box (same as HTGROWBOX). (Same as GrowBox).

member.name: F:DevComponents.WpfDock.WinApi.WindowHitTestRegions.ReduceButton
member.summary: HTREDUCE: In a Minimize button. (Same as MinimizeButton).

member.name: F:DevComponents.WpfDock.WinApi.WindowHitTestRegions.ZoomButton
member.summary: HTZOOM: In a Maximize button. (Same as MaximizeButton).
